DOC.brief_title: Is Osteopathic Manipulative Treatment ( OMT ) Beneficial Elderly Patients Hospitalized With Pneumonia ?
DOC.detailed_description: This study multi-center study conduct across five site United States determine efficacy combine Osteopathic Manipulative Treatment ( OMT ) antibiotic treatment regimen elderly patient pneumonia . The study prospective , randomize , control clinical trial , 360 subject randomly assign three different group test primary hypothesis combination OMT antibiotic decrease length hospital stay elderly patient pneumonia . The first group ( OMT Group ) receive series eight osteopathic manipulative technique combination conventional antibiotic care . The second group ( Light Touch Control Group ) receive light touch mimic treatment combination conventional antibiotic care control doctor-patient interaction . The third group ( Conventional Care Only Group ) receive conventional antibiotic care normally give elderly patient pneumonia . The first two group receive two 15-20 minute treatment per day , least six hour apart , duration stay acute care facility . The primary outcome measure efficacy : Length Hospital Stay , Time Clinical Stability , Rate Symptomatic Functional Recovery . The secondary outcome : duration IV oral antibiotic usage hospital , number complication deaths secondary pneumonia , re-admission rate within 60 day hospitalization admission date , duration severity fever , duration severity leukocytosis , patient satisfaction .
